originalText.text:
My advice: if you need help preserving or restoring an unusual photo and don't know where to start: don't start with Sebastian Wintermute Studio.

My own very polite e-mail request for Mr. Wintermute's services engendered a strange, rude  and very unhelpful response.

Instead of simply advising me, he imagined a phone conversation we did not have and lectured me.

This was a mere e-mail request for services, mind you. The man could have simply said no. He could have advised me about what sort of photo I was dealing with; he could have directed me to more appropriate services.

Still stranger, the negative review I posted on Yelp was greeted with insinuations that I am part of a cabal of meanies trying to bring Wintermute Studio down.

Sideways insinuations that I might be an anti-semite really waylaid me. The photos I sent along with my e-mail were of my husband's jewish ancestors!

Anyhoo: I'd avoid the agro and seek advice from someone who won't respond with tantrums and imaginary persecutors.

For evidence supporting this review, just look at Mr. Wintermute's responses.

originalText.text: Sebastian has helped me with a number of family wedding photo restoration projects this year and I've been thrilled with the results each time. In one case, I needed a color fix -- an old print had faded and become discolored (my mother-in-law's blond hair had turned bright orange, etc.). Through his magic he was able to bring back the original color, making it look like the photo had been snapped yesterday. In another, he was able to take an old black and white print damaged by water -- ripped and peeling, even across parts of my father in law's face -- and make it look as though nothing had ever happened. On top of his obvious skill as a restorer, he's responsive, professional and kind. I was nervous at first to part with these  treasures, but now consider Sebastian my go-to trusted source on anything photo restoration. He takes enormous care and delivers impressive results.

originalText.text:
I contacted Sebastian to have some of the photograph from our family album scanned and restores.
A friend of mine who dabbles in Photoshop tried hishand on a few of them but I was not entirely satisfied and wanted to find a professional to help.
Sebastian and I had an initial consultation over wine and cheese at the local pub we discussed what needed to be done and how long it may take.
Within a week Sebastian had all the photos from the album scanned and in another week he had all of photos retouched, organized, and cataloged.
He also added some additional touches based on my comments and in a little over a month right in time for the holidays we had beautifully restored photographs and a set of pints ready for framing. I was very impressed.
Sebastian enthusiasm for his work and for her clients was very refreshing and I highly recommend that you contact him if you have any photographs that you want to be restores with loving care.

originalText.text:
It was a real pleasure to meet and do business with Sebastian. Originally I expected the place to be just another photo lab but instead I walked into a real artist's studio was given a lecture on history and architecture of the Lower East Side illustrated with amazing historic photographs that I've never seen before, offered a glass of wine, had my photo albums inspected and quizzed on the history of my family.

Sebastian explained clearly how the restoration process works and what the final results will be, and how much it will cost. He even recommended that I contact two other places to compare prices and services. Needles to say I was sold.

It took some time for Sebastian to scan and retouch over three hundred photos, many of which I assumed to be beyond any hope, but he did an amazing job and most of the photos came out as good as they were before our family albums including my parents beautiful wedding album were ruined when out basement got flooded after the storm.

My parents and everyone else were overjoyed when after the Thanksgiving dinner we were able to view the photograph on the large screen TV. All of us are grateful to Sebastian for saving the precious pieces of our family history and making them available for many more years.

originalText.text: I searched all over and read countless reviews before selecting someone to restore a photo that was taken during my grandmother’s wedding back in 1948.  I cannot express how thrilled I am that I chose Sebastian to do so.  From the onset, he was extremely responsive and informative about the process.  Before agreeing to take on the job, he had me send over a scan to ensure that he could perform his services to my satisfaction.  We then had a phone call to talk through the process and to confirm the scope was correct.  Upon receipt of the finished product, I couldn’t be happier.  The missing pieces of the photo were miraculously repaired as if they were never lost. Sebastian had so much enthusiasm during the whole process, I couldn’t recommend him more.
